workflow.name: Automatic email invoice archiving & data extraction with Gmail, Drive & AI
workflow.description:
# Automated Invoice Archiving

Automatically fetch, store, and extract key information from invoices received via email from your ISP or utility provider (electricity, gas, telecom, water, etc.).The workflow saves the invoices to Google Drive (or optionally to your personal FTP/SFTP server) and logs all invoice details into Google Sheets via AI-powered extraction.

![Asset1.png](fileId:3405)

Read: [Full setup Guide](https://paoloronco.it/n8n-template-automated-invoice-archiving/)

### How it works

1. **Scheduled Trigger**Runs the workflow at a selected interval (e.g., every hour). You can freely adjust the timing.
  
2. **Gmail ‚Äì Fetch Messages**Reads your Gmail inbox and retrieves only messages coming from your ISP/utility provider‚Äôs email address, filtering for messages with PDF attachments.
  
3. **Gmail ‚Äì Download Invoice** Fetches the full email content and downloads the attached invoice (PDF).
  
4. **Google Drive ‚Äì Upload File** Uploads the invoice into a specific Google Drive folder of your choice.
  
5. **(Optional) Upload to FTP/SFTP** Sends a copy of the invoice to your personal server via secure FTP/SFTP.
  
6. **AI Extraction Pipeline**
  
  * **Extract PDF Text** ‚Äì converts the PDF into text (OCR not required if text-based).
    
  * **AI Agent (OpenRouter)** ‚Äì understands the invoice content and extracts structured fields (invoice number, date, provider name, total amount, tax info, line items, etc.)
    
  * **Code Node** ‚Äì sanitizes and parses the JSON from the AI model.
    
7. **Google Sheets ‚Äì Append Invoice Data**Adds a new row to your Google Sheet with all parsed invoice fields.
  
8. **(Optional) Cleanup**Automatically deletes:‚Äì the Gmail message‚Äì the temporary file in Google Drive(Useful when you only want your FTP or Sheets copy.)
  

### Parameters to configure

| Parameter | Description | Recommended configuration |
| --- | --- | --- |
| **Gmail Credentials** | OAuth2 credentials needed to read and delete emails. | Create OAuth credentials on Google Cloud ‚Üí enable Gmail API ‚Üí paste Client ID & Secret into n8n ‚Üí ‚ÄúConnect OAuth2‚Äù. |
| **Sender Email Filter** | Email address your provider uses to send invoices. | Example: `billing@your-isp.com`, `invoices@utility.it`, `ciao@octopusenergy.it` |
| **Google Drive Folder** | Destination folder for saving invoices. | Copy the folder ID from the Drive URL and paste it into `folderId`. |
| **Google Drive Credentials** | OAuth2 connection for file uploads/deletions. | Same Google Cloud project ‚Üí enable Drive API ‚Üí OAuth connect in n8n. |
| **FTP/SFTP Server (optional)** | Upload invoices to your private server. | Host / IP ¬∑ Port ¬∑ Username ¬∑ Password or SSH Key ¬∑ Destination path (e.g. `/home/user/invoices/`). |
| **AI Model (OpenRouter)** | Large-language model used to parse invoice text. | Example: `gpt-4.1`, `llama-3.1`, or any preferred OpenRouter model. |
| **Google Sheets Document** | Destination spreadsheet for structured data. | Create a Sheet ‚Üí add columns (Vendor, Invoice Number, Date, Amount, Service Type, etc.) ‚Üí insert `documentId` & sheet name. |
| **Sheets Credentials (Service Account)** | Used for writing into Google Sheets. | Create Service Account ‚Üí download JSON ‚Üí add to n8n ‚Üí share the Sheet with the Service Account email. |
| **Trigger Interval** | How often the workflow checks for new invoices. | Every hour ¬∑ every 30 minutes ¬∑ daily at set ti |

## Node-by-node breakdown

### **1. Schedule Trigger**

Runs at the interval you choose (default: hourly).Start ‚Üí triggers entire workflow.

* * *

### **2. Gmail ‚Äì Get Many Messages**

Filters inbox items using:

* **Sender email** (your ISP/utility address)
  
* **Has attachment**
  
* **Unread or recent messages**
  

Downloads metadata + attachment references.

* * *

### **3. Filter ‚Äì Contains Attachment**

Ensures only messages with binary attachments continue.

* * *

### **4. Gmail ‚Äì Get Invoice**

Downloads:

* Full email JSON
  
* The invoice PDF (binary data)
  

* * *

### **5. Google Drive ‚Äì Upload File**

Uploads invoice PDF with a dynamic filename:

`{{ $json.from.value[0].name }}-{{ $json.date }}.pdf`

Requires:

* Google Drive OAuth2 credentials
  
* Folder ID (destination directory)
  

* * *

### **6. HTTP Request ‚Äì Download File**

Retrieves the raw PDF file from Google Drive for further processing.

* * *

### **7. (Optional) FTP/SFTP Upload**

Uploads the PDF to your server using:

* Host / IP
  
* Port (default 22)
  
* Username
  
* Password or private key
  
* Destination path
  

Filename is sanitized to ensure Unix compatibility.

* * *

### **8. (Optional) Delete Temporary File**

Deletes the Google Drive file if you don‚Äôt want duplicates.

* * *

### **9. (Optional) Delete Gmail Message**

Removes the original email once processed (optional inbox cleanup).

* * *

### **10. Extract from File (PDF ‚Üí Text)**

Reads the PDF and extracts raw text for AI processing.

* * *

### **11. OpenRouter Chat Model**

LLM backend for the AI agent. Provides:

* invoice parsing
  
* field extraction
  
* structured reasoning
  

* * *

### **12. AI Agent ‚Äì Extract Invoice Fields**

The agent is instructed to return **strict JSON only**, containing keys such as:

* `vendor_name`
  
* `invoice_number`
  
* `invoice_date`
  
* `total_amount`
  
* `tax_details`
  
* `line_items[]`
  
* `po_number`
  
* `po_date`
  

Works for most standard PDF invoices.

* * *

### **13. Code ‚Äì Clean & Parse JSON**

Sanitizes the AI output:

* Removes markdown fences
  
* Extracts valid JSON
  
* Parses into a clean JS object
  

If the AI output is malformed, debugging info is returned.

* * *

### **14. Google Sheets ‚Äì Append Data**

Appends the extracted fields into a structured row.Example mappings:

* **Vendor** ‚Üí `{{ $json.vendor_name }}`
  
* **Invoice Number** ‚Üí `{{ $json.invoice_number }}`
  
* **Date** ‚Üí `{{ $json.invoice_date }}`
  
* **Amount** ‚Üí `{{ $json.total_amount }}`
  
* **Service Type** ‚Üí `{{ $json.line_items[0].description }}`
  

* * *

## üí° Tips & best practices

* Add multiple sender filters if you have **more than one utility provider**.
  
* Ensure invoices are **text-based PDFs** for best extraction results.
  
* Use Google Drive as a reliable long-term archive, or keep only FTP if you prefer local storage.
  
* Create charts in Google Sheets for tracking:
  
  * Monthly utility cost trends
    
  * Year-over-year comparison
    
  * Consumption spikes (if included in invoices)
    

* * *

## ‚ö†Ô∏è Important notes

* Utility invoices contain **personal and financial data**. Keep your FTP/SFTP server secure.
  
* Google APIs require proper OAuth2 or Service Account setup; misconfiguration may cause permission errors.
  
* This workflow is for **personal automation**, not a replacement for official fiscal archiving.
  
* AI extraction quality depends on invoice formatting and the model you choose.

parameters.text:
=- You must respond ONLY with valid raw rendered JSON.
- Do NOT include the word "json".
- Do NOT include the word "```json".
- Do NOT use triple backticks or markdown formatting.
- Do NOT wrap the response in any key like "output".
- Do NOT write anything starting at output directly start with valid root-level JSON.
- Only respond with a valid, root-level JSON object.
- Do NOT skip any line item. Continue extracting all line items until the sum of all line_total values exactly equals the total sale amount extracted from the invoice. This verification ensures that all items are fully extracted and no entries are missed. If the totals do not match, keep parsing and extracting additional line items until they do. Only then stop.

Text to convert: {{ $json.text }}

options.systemMessage:
You are a document parsing assistant designed to extract structured data from invoice PDFs for automated uploading and validation in a financial system.

Extract the following fields from the invoice text:

invoice_number: Extract from the 'Invoice No' field.

vendor_name: Company name issuing the invoice.

invoice_date: Format as DD/MM/YYYY.

po_number: Extract the PO number or return null if not found.

po_date: Extract the PO date in DD/MM/YYYY format or return null if not found.

total_amount: Extract the invoice total as a float.

tax_details: Include total CGST, total SGST.

line_items: List of all items in the invoice. For each item, extract:

  Serial No.: Item Serial No. In invoice.

  code: The TWW word and its postfix only (e.g., TWW, TWW-Cover, TWW-HPCN). Do not include HSN code or numbers. This field must always be present.

  description: Item description, never include HSN code of product in product description.

  last character: This is a single word/character string found just after or around the line item, typically at the end of the price line or just on the next line. It will never be a number, HSN code, GST %, or unit (like PCS). Examples: G, C, S, 5C, .C If nothing is present (only digits or blank), return "". Check the next 1‚Äì2 lines after each item if it's not found on the same line.

  quantity: Quantity value.

  unit_price: Price per unit.

  line_total: Total price for the line.

  hsn_code: HSN code of the item.

  cgst: Only extract the CGST percentage (e.g., 9%, 6%) as written in the invoice. Do not calculate based on line total.

  sgst: Only extract the SGST percentage (e.g., 9%, 6%) as written in the invoice. Do not calculate based on line total.

Important: Double-check that all line items are extracted without omission.

Do NOT skip any line item. Continue extracting all line items until the sum of all line_total values exactly equals the total_amount extracted from the invoice. This verification ensures that all items are fully extracted and no entries are missed. If the totals do not match, keep parsing and extracting additional line items until they do. Only then stop.

parameters.content:
## Automated Invoice Archiving - overview

This workflow automatically collects invoice emails from your ISP/utility provider, saves attached PDFs to Google Drive (and optionally SFTP), extracts key invoice data using AI, and logs them into Google Sheets.

Read: [Full setup Guide](https://paoloronco.it/n8n-template-automated-invoice-archiving/)

### How it Works (High-Level)

1. **Trigger** ‚Äì Runs at your chosen interval.
2. **Email Filter** ‚Äì Fetches only messages from the sender you specify and only if they include PDF attachments.
3. **Download Invoice** ‚Äì Retrieves the email and PDF file.
4. **Save to Drive** ‚Äì Uploads the PDF to a selected Google Drive folder.
    (Optional) SFTP Upload ‚Äì Sends a copy to your server.
5. **Extract Text** ‚Äì Converts the PDF to text.
6. **AI Parsing** ‚Äì Extracts invoice fields (vendor, date, total, line items, taxes, etc.).
7. **Cleanup** (Optional) ‚Äì Delete email and/or Google Drive temp file.
8. **Append to Sheets** ‚Äì Saves selected fields into your Google Sheet.

### Tips

- Works best with text-based PDFs.
- SFTP, Gmail deletion, and Drive deletion are optional.
- You can use different senders for different providers.
- Sheets can be used to chart or monitor consumption over time.

### Important

Invoices may contain sensitive data.
Use secure storage, APIs, and accounts.

### SECTION 1 Trigger

Runs the workflow on a schedule you choose. Adjust interval as needed (hourly, daily, etc.).

### SECTION 2.1 ‚Äî Email Intake & Attachment filtering

Fetches messages from a specific sender and filters only emails containing PDF attachments.

**Setup:**
In **Gmail ‚Üí Get Many Messages**, enter the sender email that sends you invoices.

Configure your Gmail OAuth2 account: [üîó Gmail Node Docs](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.gmail/)

### SECTION 3 ‚Äî Download & Storage

Downloads the invoice PDF and saves it to Google Drive. You can optionally upload a copy to your FTP/SFTP server.

**Google Drive:**
Connect your Drive account: [üîó Google Drive Docs](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.googledrive/)
Insert the **Folder ID** where invoices will be stored.

**FTP/SFTP (optional):**
Set up your FTP/SFTP credentials: [üîó FTP Node Docs](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/core-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.ftp/)
In **PATH**, enter the directory where files should be saved. Leave other fields unchanged.

### SECTION 4 ‚Äî PDF Text Extraction

Converts the PDF into text before sending it to the AI model. OCR not required unless the PDF is image-only.

### SECTION 5 ‚Äî AI Parsing

The AI Agent extracts structured data (date, vendor, amount, items). The Code node cleans the JSON.

**Setup**
 Enter your LLM provider API key (OpenRouter/OpenAI).
 Ensure you have available credits.
 Select your preferred model (GPT-4.1, Llama 3, etc.).
 No additional configuration needed.

### SECTION 6 - GoogleSheets Logging

**Setup**
Connect your Google Sheets Service Account.
Set **Document ID** and **Sheet Name**.
Create these columns in the first row:

* **Vendor**
* **Type**
* **Date**
* **Amount**

### Section 3: Check if already existing

Prevents duplicate processing of the same email.
This section checks whether the current Gmail message has already been processed by looking up its Gmail message ID in a Google Sheets registry.

Configuration
* Set the Google Sheets document and sheet name.
* Ensure the sheet has a uniqueKey column containing Gmail message IDs.

### Section 2.2

Get attachment from Gmail 
(binary file)

user.name: Paolo Ronco
user.bio:
Cybersecurity Analyst passionate about automation, cloud, and infrastructure.
Since discovering n8n, I automate everything I can: workflows, processes, integrations, and repetitive tasks.
I love building, optimizing, and making systems more secure, faster, and scalable.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
